alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Kaibab Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 14 at 2:00PM MST until February 15 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches below 6000 feet, with 6 to 12 inches above 6000 feet. Locally higher amounts of up to 20 inches possible over the highest elevations along the Mogollon Rim. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Areas near Dilkon, Doney Park, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Fredonia, Heber-Overgaard, Holbrook, Jacob Lake, Kykotsmovi, Page, Prescott, Prescott Valley, Sedona, Seligman, Snowflake- Taylor, Valle, Williams and Winslow. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Additional snow forecast from 1 PM Today to 6 AM Wednesday: Dilkon 2 to 4 inches Doney Park 5 to 9 inches Flagstaff 7 to 11 inches Forest Lakes 15 to 21 inches Fredonia 1 to 3 inches Heber-Overgaard 8 to 12 inches Holbrook 2 to 4 inches Jacob Lake 9 to 13 inches Kykotsmovi 1 to 2 inches Page 1 to 3 inches Prescott 2 to 4 inches Prescott Valley 1 to 3 inches Sedona 1 to 2 inches Seligman 0 to 1 inches Snowflake-Taylr 3 to 5 inches Valle 2 to 4 inches Williams 5 to 9 inches Winslow 1 to 2 inches .
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
